pullRequest.body:
Define the extremal number `extremalNumber n H` of a natural number `n` and a simple graph `H`: `extremalNumber n H` is the maximum number of edges in a `H`-free simple graph on `n` vertices, if `H` is contained in all simple graphs on `n` vertices, then this is `0`.

Also define the predicate that a simple graph is an extremal graph `IsExtremal` satisfying some predicate.

---

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

-->

### PR summary [385732f710](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19865/commits/385732f710c41e8cb18ba4ff3364f64352d56858)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SimpleGraph.Extremal.Basic` (new file)|773|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Free.congr_left`
`+ Free.congr_right`
`+ IsContained.congr_left`
`+ IsContained.congr_right`
`+ IsContained.extremalNumber_le`
`+ IsContained.of_extremalNumber_lt_card_edgeFinset`
`+ IsExtremal`
`+ IsExtremal.prop`
`+ card_edgeFinset_le_extremalNumber`
`+ card_edgeFinset_of_isExtremal_free`
`+ exists_isExtremal_free`
`+ exists_isExtremal_iff_exists`
`+ extremalNumber`
`+ extremalNumber_congr`
`+ extremalNumber_congr_right`
`+ extremalNumber_le_iff`
`+ extremalNumber_le_iff_of_nonneg`
`+ extremalNumber_of_fintypeCard_eq`
`+ free_congr_left`
`+ free_congr_right`
`+ isContained_congr_left`
`+ isContained_congr_right`
`+ isExtremal_free_iff`
`+ lt_extremalNumber_iff`
`+ lt_extremalNumber_iff_of_nonneg`
`++++ _`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This is the first of a few PRs for a formalisation of the Erd≈ës-Stone-Simonovits theorem. I created the new directory `Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Extremal` as I intend to put a couple files here that really only pertain to extremal graph theory, e.g., Tur√°n density.

The definitions in this PR do generalise a couple existing definitions, e.g., `IsTuranMaximal r` iff `IsExtremal (¬∑.CliqueFree (r+1))` in `Turan.lean`. If this PR is successful it might be worth rewriting bits of `Turan.lean` using these common definitions, e.g.,
```
theorem extremalNumber_completeGraph
    (Œ≤ Œ± : Type*) [Fintype Œ≤] [DecidableEq Œ≤] [Fintype Œ±] [Nontrivial Œ±] :
    extremalNumber Œ≤ (completeGraph Œ±) =
      (turanGraph (Fintype.card Œ≤) (Fintype.card Œ±-1)).edgeFinset.card := sorry
```
```
theorem card_edgeFinset_eq_extremalNumber_completeGraph_iff_iso_turanGraph
    {Œ≤: Type*} [Fintype Œ≤] (G : SimpleGraph Œ≤) [DecidableRel G.Adj]
    (Œ± : Type*) [Fintype Œ±] [Nontrivial Œ±] :
    (completeGraph Œ±).Free G ‚àß
        G.edgeFinset.card = extremalNumber Œ≤ (completeGraph Œ±)
      ‚Üî Nonempty (G ‚âÉg turanGraph (Fintype.card Œ≤) (Fintype.card Œ±-1)) := sorry
```

Thank you for the PR! I have written a version of this a year and a half ago [here](https://github.com/YaelDillies/LeanCamCombi/blob/master/LeanCamCombi/Mathlib/Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Containment.lean). I can't really type in the foreseeable future now, so I will just say that there is potential to make both APIs nicer by combining them

> Thank you for the PR! I have written a version of this a year and a half ago [here](https://github.com/YaelDillies/LeanCamCombi/blob/master/LeanCamCombi/Mathlib/Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/Containment.lean). I can't really type in the foreseeable future now, so I will just say that there is potential to make both APIs nicer by combining them

@YaelDillies It is interesting to see how similar the code is in some places. I also had some code implementing essentially your `labelledCopyCount`, but didn't PR it cause I don't need it for Erd≈ës-Stone-Simonovits. I also tried to implement `copyCount` instead by counting classes of subgraph isomorphisms under the equivalence `fun f‚ÇÅ f‚ÇÇ : A ‚â≤g B ‚Ü¶ ‚àÉ h : B ‚â≤g B, f‚ÇÅ = h.comp f‚ÇÇ`, but didn't know enough about Lean at the time to realize it properly (and haven't thought about it since).

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20658~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Please move all these parts to a separate file; they don't need to be in a file about extremal properties.

Also, consider separating them into a smaller PR. I would happily merge that one, but don't personally have time/inclination to think about the `extremalNumber` part.

I've put them in `Mathlib/Combinatorics/SimpleGraph/SubgraphIso.lean`.

See #20658.

Why take an arbitrary fintype instead of one of the canonical ones?
```suggestion
noncomputable def extremalNumber (n : ‚Ñï) (A : SimpleGraph Œ±) : ‚Ñï :=
  sup { B : SimpleGraph (Fin n) | A.Free B } (#¬∑.edgeFinset)
```

> Why take an arbitrary fintype instead of one of the canonical ones?

It is less hassle to have the supremum over the fintype of the graph you are looking at. Tl;dr: In golfing my proof of Erd≈ës-Stone-Simonovits I got rid of _a lot_ of "useless" code with this (not just what is mentioned below).

Say I have a simple graph over an arbitrary fintype `G : SimpleGraph V` such that `h : G.CliqueFree (r+1)` and I want to reason that `#G.edgeFinset ‚â§ #(turanGraph (card V) r).edgeFinset`.

If I have `h_turan {V} : extremalNumber V ‚ä§ = #(turanGraph (card V) r).edgeFinset`, then this proof is something like `rw [‚Üêh_turan]; exact le_extremalNumber (top_free_iff_cliqueFree.mpr h)`. There is no point here that requires isomorphisms to simple graphs over one of the canonical fintypes nor any reasoning that everything true of the original graph is true of the isomorphic graph (no "useless" code).

Say I have `h_turan : extremalNumber n ‚ä§ = #(turanGraph n r).edgeFinset` and the supremum is over `Fin n` instead. 
- If I'm nice, I encapsulate this and `le_extremal` (and alike lemmas/theorems) use `G.overFin hc` and `(G.overFinIso hc).card_edgeFinset_eq` to prove `#G.edgeFinset ‚â§ extremalNumber (card V) H` (I write the "useless" code). 
- If I'm not nice, then `le_extremal` only applies to `G : SimpleGraph (Fin n)` and proves `#G.edgeFinset ‚â§ extremalNumber n H`; I push the responsibility onto the one with the simple graph over an arbitrary fintype (they write the "useless" code).

@YaelDillies Is taking an arbitrary fintype a problem here? What are your thoughts? (I think of it as instead of a graph $$G$$ with $$v(G) = n$$ vertices, we have a graph on a finite vertex type `G : SimpleGraph V`; likewise instead of $$\text{ex}(n, H)$$ we might have `extremalNumber V H`.)

I agree with Ya√´l, and that you should make the version for natural numbers together with the API which allows it to be used for arbitrary fintypes that you describe. The broader reason why it's good to be concrete here is that it makes the definition of this function not have a useless universe variable, which is important when you start quantifying over n, or doing natural number computations on it. (This is what we do for Roth numbers, and what I did for Ramsey numbers and a bunch of other combinatorial quantities defined in this way, for instance)

@b-mehta I've allowed for arbitrary fintypes using
```
theorem extremalNumber_eq_sup_overFin {n : ‚Ñï} [Fintype V] (hc : card V = n) :
    extremalNumber n H = sup { G : SimpleGraph V | H.Free G } (#¬∑.edgeFinset) := sorry
```
that just adapts the definition over `Fin n` to the previous definition over `V`.

What about
```suggestion
/-- If `A ‚âÉg H` and `B ‚âÉg G` then `A` is contained in `B` if and only if `H` is contained in `G`. -/
theorem isContained_congr (eH : H\_1 ‚âÉg H\_2) (eG : G\_1 ‚âÉg G\_2) : H\_1 ‚äë G\_1 ‚Üî H\_2 ‚äë G\_2 :=
  ‚ü®.trans' ‚ü®eG.toCopy‚ü© ‚àò .trans ‚ü®eH.symm.toCopy‚ü©, .trans' ‚ü®eG.symm.toCopy‚ü© ‚àò .trans ‚ü®eH.toCopy‚ü©‚ü©
```
Sorry, can't unicode
Same here

It's precisely not a sup over `Fin n`
```suggestion
theorem extremalNumber_of_fintypeCard_eq {n : ‚Ñï} [Fintype V] (hc : card V = n) :
    extremalNumber n H = sup { G : SimpleGraph V | H.Free G } (#¬∑.edgeFinset) := by
```
Yeah, this is a way better name. I didn't know what to call it.

```suggestion
theorem card_edgeFinset_le_extremalNumber (h : H.Free G) : #G.edgeFinset ‚â§ extremalNumber (card V) H := by
```
maybe? Even better might be to have an `abbrev` for `#G.edgeFinset`. It's a very common idiom of course

```suggestion
theorem Free.of_extremalNumber_lt_card_edgeFinset (h : extremalNumber (card V) H < #G.edgeFinset) : H ‚äë G := by
```
`IsContained.of_extremalNumber_lt_card_edgeFinset`. :+1:

```suggestion
theorem IsContained.extremalNumber_le_card_edgeFinset {W' : Type*} {H' : SimpleGraph W'} (h : H' ‚äë H) :
```

The statement is `H' ‚äë H ‚Üí extremalNumber n H' ‚â§ extremalNumber n H`. I don't think you meant `..._le_card_edgeFinset`.

What about `IsContained.extremalNumber_le`?

```suggestion
@[congr]
theorem extremalNumber_congr {W‚ÇÅ W‚ÇÇ : Type*} {H‚ÇÅ : SimpleGraph W‚ÇÅ} {H‚ÇÇ : SimpleGraph W‚ÇÇ} (hmn : m = n)
    (e : H‚ÇÅ ‚âÉg H‚ÇÇ) : extremalNumber m H‚ÇÅ = extremalNumber n H‚ÇÇ := by
```
@apnelson1, any chance we can have `MaximalWrt` as a variant of `Maximal`?
@YaelDillies its the `[DecidableRel H.Adj]` that is the problem; this def just generalizes the existing `IsTuranMaximal`.
Then certainly we should have a version of `#H.edgeFinset` that doesn't require `DecidableRel H.Adj`!
It should only require `Fintype H.edgeSet`, no decidability assumption...

The reason it does is that a general simple graph over a fintype doesn't necessarily have a decidable adjacency relation, meaning we can't cut out a `Fintype H.edgeSet` instance from the `Fintype (Sym2 V)` one

Can we keep this one around (proved as a special case of the new one), called `isContained_congr_left`, and also have the right version? It could also be nice to have dot notation for the single-implication versions (which is eg common through the topology library)

> It could also be nice to have dot notation for the single-implication versions (which is eg common through the topology library)

I'm a little uninitiated. You mean `IsContained.congr_left`, `IsContained.congr_right` right?
Yup, exactly!
as before!
nit: `x` feels like a weird letter to use here. Can we have `m`, since that usually denotes an edge count? Similarly below.
I hold no allegiance to `x`. :grin:
Can we have the `congr_right` version of this, where n is fixed, for ease of use in rewriting

```suggestion
  p G ‚àß ‚àÄ (H : SimpleGraph V) [Fintype H.edgeSet], p H ‚Üí #H.edgeFinset ‚â§ #G.edgeFinset
```
and similarly below

I'll change it everywhere in the file, including the `extremalNumber_le_iff`, `lt_extremalNumber_iff` theorems. 

EDIT: this breaks *a lot* of things downsteam... I've reverted it for now.

This file has ended up having a weird hybrid of `A : SimpleGraph alpha` and `G : SimpleGraph V`, and the fact that you needed to introduce new `Type`s here is an unfortunate symptom of that... Probably fixing that should be an independent PR, but for now, how bad would it be to use the existing ones from the top of the file?
I did that originally, I'll just revert to that. :+1:

Oops, my fault, I should've been clearer here.

```suggestion
lemma isContained_congr_left {W‚ÇÅ W‚ÇÇ : Type*} {H‚ÇÅ : SimpleGraph W‚ÇÅ} {H‚ÇÇ : SimpleGraph W‚ÇÇ}
  (eH : H‚ÇÅ ‚âÉg H‚ÇÇ) : H‚ÇÅ ‚äë G ‚Üî H‚ÇÇ ‚äë G := isContained_congr eH Iso.refl

lemma isContained_congr_right {V‚ÇÅ V‚ÇÇ : Type*} {G‚ÇÅ : SimpleGraph V‚ÇÅ} {G‚ÇÇ : SimpleGraph V‚ÇÇ}
  (eG : G‚ÇÅ ‚âÉg G‚ÇÇ) : H ‚äë G‚ÇÅ ‚Üî H ‚äë G‚ÇÇ := isContained_congr Iso.refl eG
```
then the forward implication can be made like:
```
alias ‚ü®_, IsContained.congr_left‚ü© := isContained_congr_left
```

```suggestion
    G.IsExtremal H.Free ‚Üî H.Free G ‚àß #G.edgeFinset = extremalNumber (card V) H := by
```

Ooh, I should've noticed this earlier, but I think this is the real important definition. To me it seems like `IsExtremal` should be the first thing in the file, and the reminder is the specialization to when `p` is the property of being H-free. It's even tempting to define extremal numbers with respect to any property, not just `p = H.Free`, but I'm content with that being a TODO for now - certainly the commonly studied case is the one you've given.

No I think this is a great idea, e.g., `isExtremal_free_iff` is true in general then. Nothing here needs to be in terms of `H.Free`!

I don't mind `extremalNumber n H.Free` either, its more self-documenting.

I can't do it! :sweat_smile:

E.g., `extremalNumber n H = sup { G : SimpleGraph V | H.Free G } (#¬∑.edgeFinset)` here the `H.Free` on the left-hand side in the definition of `extremalNumber` is not the `H.Free` on the right-hand side, its universe-polymorphism.

I'd need `extremalNumber` to take some kind of universal predicate 
```
variable (p.{u} : Œ† {W : Type u}, SimpleGraph W ‚Üí Prop)
``` 
but you can't quantify over universe levels like this...
Hmm, I'm not quite sure I follow, I still think this should work, but let's leave this generalisation for the time being!

```suggestion
/-- If `H` has at least one edge, then there exists an extremal `H.Free` graph. -/
```

nit:
```suggestion
lemma isContained_congr_left (e‚ÇÅ : A ‚âÉg B) : A ‚äë C ‚Üî B ‚äë C := isContained_congr e‚ÇÅ .refl
```
Same below

I am tempted to do, but unsure it's a good idea
```suggestion
  p G ‚àß ‚àÄ ‚¶ÉG' : SimpleGraph V‚¶Ñ [DecidableRel G'.Adj], p G' ‚Üí #G'.edgeFinset ‚â§ #G.edgeFinset
```

I am tempted to shorten this name, eg
```suggestion
noncomputable def extremalNum (n : ‚Ñï) {W : Type*} (H : SimpleGraph W) : ‚Ñï :=
```
because it's such a fundamental quantity that will keep on showing up in lemma names and intermediate computations, and has notation $e(...)$ in paper maths.

pullRequest.title: feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): define extremalNumber
